1.title: The worst 'Dollivery' ever!
1.plot: Hearing a scream outside her home at night, Christine calls Dave and goes out to investigate. She finds a live body wrapped in plastic, bloodied and made up like a doll - and it's Mickey, barely conscious.

2.title: Mickey is in bad shape. I'm so distraught!
2.plot: Because Christine is overcome, Dave explains to the camera that paramedics tending to Mickey. When Detective Francis arrives, Dave berates him for inaction and says he dug up evidence on his own. Francis says that would be inadmissible.

3.title: CREEPY guy approaches me in parking lot
3.plot: After checking Mickey at the ICU, Christine walks to her car in the lot and is accosted by a stranger who asks for jumper cables, then a cigarette, then somewhere they can talk. Jack shows up and chases the stranger off.

4.title: A safe place for the night
4.plot: With nowhere else to stay, Christine texts Blaine to ask if she can come to his place. He welcomes her and shows her to a guest room. But while they leave the camera running, it catches something.

5.title: I know who's stalking me!
5.plot: Christine spots Carl's parked car. Inside, she spots the purple notebook and her lost robe. She gets into the car but someone climbs on the roof. It's Carl. She manages to flee with the notebook.

6.title: I have the notebook! Now what?
6.plot: After driving to a safe place to examine the notebook, Christine leaves phone messages for Dave and Detective Francis. A frantic video message from Angel mentions visions of dolls, meat on a table, and 'wood everywhere!'

7.title: More creepy discoveries about Carl
7.plot: Philip - the guy from the parking garage - shows up and says he helped Carl shoot creepy videos and leave 'dolliveries' at her house, but stopped being his friend. She realizes Angel's vision must lead to MeeMaw's barn.

8.title: What is going on at MeeMaw's?
8.plot: Christine and Dave spy on MeeMaw's: Carl drives up yelling for Zeke but runs in a panic from the barn. Blaine arrives, calls for Carl, and goes into the barn. Carl and a man shouting at him in a strange accent emerge and drive off.

9.title: A HORRIFYING discovery
9.plot: Christine and Dave enter the barn. She recognizes some outfits hanging from the rafters. Then Dave hears something and goes out, and Christine stumbles on a terrifying sight and almost gets caught by someone.

10.title: A psychopath in MeeMaw's barn!
10.plot: Christine climbs to the attic of the barn and discovers two bodies, a table of raw meat, and Dia tied to a chair. But the figure in black returns and prepares to go to work on the "pretty lady" while Christine watches in hiding.

11.title: Showdown in Meemaw's barn
11.plot: Carl confronts Ezekiel, who is preparing to turn Dia into jerky. Dave tackles Carl, and Ezekiel discovers Christine filming him from hiding, and all hell breaks loose.

12.title: A reason to celebrate ... or is it?
12.plot: It's New Year's Eve, and Christine celebrates her triumph and Dia's survival, with Jack. Then the doorbell rings, and puts a damper on the evening.

1.title: In Case I Go Missing
1.plot: Sunshine Girl reports that her friend Christine sent this video to her. Christine fears someone is stalking her and has decided to vlog anything creepy that happens to her.

2.title: CREEPY! I'm Not Expecting Visitors!
2.plot: Someone keeps ringing Chrstine's doorbell, but when she answers, no one's there. Is it a neighbor, or is she being stalked?

3.title: I'm Going to Catch the Creeper on Camera
3.plot: While attempting to catch the creeper on camera, Christine discovers a glove. Somebody is clearly messing with her, but why?

4.title: My Best Friend Is Creeped Out!
4.plot: Christine calls her best friend Mickey for support and advice. Neither can figure out why someone would want to scare her. Should they go to the police?

5.title: I Called the Police. Now I Feel Like an Idiot!
5.plot: Christine called the police, but they said there was nothing they could do, and a neighbor kid was probably just playing a prank on her. Still frightened, she wonders if she is blowing things out of proportion.

6.title: A Creepy Gift on My Doorstep
6.plot: Someone left a scary gift on Christine's doorstep. Luckily a pair of her neighbors were passing by and agreed to come in while she opened it. She's not happy about what she finds.

7.title: A Very Un-Merry Christmas
7.plot: Tired of the ding-dong ditch game, Christine makes up her mind to talk to her property management company about putting in security monitors, and to talk to her neighbor Dave, who is reportedly a police officer.

8.title: I Talk to My Neighbor. He Is STRANGE!
8.plot: Christine goes to talk to her neighbor across the street, but he doesn't seem to want to get involved and seems a little creepy.

9.title: Creepy Neighbor Says There's Nothing I Can Do!
9.plot: Dave says the same thing as the police: there's nothing they can do for her. He also has a few other unsettling things to say.

10.title: Another Sleepless Night!
10.plot: Another round of ringing and knocking gives Christine another sleepless night.

11.title: The Creepiest Gift EVER!
11.plot: Christine receives another creepy-looking gift, sealed with duct tape, on her doorstep. She calls Dave and Mickey before opening it, but neither answers. So she opens it herself and is appalled by the contents.

12.title: I Called a Stalker Hotline!
12.plot: Christine called a 1-800 number for people who are being stalked. They told her she was doing everything right, and there's nothing more that anyone can do, including the police.

1.title: Stalker Caught on Camera
1.plot: At the coffee shop, Mickey catches someone filming from outside. She tells Christine to inform their boss, but Christine is afraid that would endanger her job.

2.title: Setting Up a Hidden Camera at Work
2.plot: Mickey is horrified to hear what neighbor Dave had to say about the stalking problem. If the police can't help Christine, she'll have to be her own investigator. She sets up a hidden camera at work.

3.title: Someone's at My Bathroom Window
3.plot: Christine tries to document what's causing the incessant rapping on her bathroom window. Of course, as soon as she turns on the camera, it stops.

4.title: Creeper in My Backyard!
4.plot: Christine called her property management firm three times, and they've done nothing. Now the creepy person has left another present: the other glove. When is her nightmare going to be over?

5.title: Neighbor Dave Sees Something
5.plot: Christine notices that her neighbor Dave keeps peeking out his window. What could he be looking at? She's afraid to go and ask in case her answer turns out to be something scary.

6.title: A Car Was Trailing Us! SO SCARY!
6.plot: Christine and Mickey freak out on their way home from the gym when a car follows too close and honks repeatedly. Someone definitely wanted to get their attention.

7.title: The Barbie Doll Was on a Noose!
7.plot: Christine's torment jumps to a new height when she finds a bloody, bound Barbie doll hung from a tree in her backyard by a noose. Who would want to terrorize her this way?

8.title: Creepy Knocking on My Car Window
8.plot: Somebody was knocking on Christine's rear car window, but by the time she got the video cam turned on, the creep was gone.

9.title: SCARY! Someone at My Bedroom Window
9.plot: The clock says 3:31 a.m., and somebody was just outside Christine's bedroom window.

10.title: Carl's Creepy Advice? Never Sleep Again
10.plot: Christine takes the bag of creepy gifts to the coffee shop, to get them out of her house. Mickey decides to document them. Carl says Christine should never go to sleep again.

11.title: Slumber Party Ruined! SCARY!
11.plot: Since Christine hasn't been sleeping, Mickey comes over for a slumber party. Late in the night, a visitor disturbs their rest with an open window.

12.title: Ugh! More CREEPY Gifts!
12.plot: Christine's doorbell rings late at night, and it's another unwelcome gift. Mickey comes over to be present when Christine opens it.

13.title: I Finally Have a Lead in Creepy Stalker Case
13.plot: Carl saw Christine's ex-boyfriend Bryan peeking in the coffee shop, and thinks he might be the creepy stalker. Christine is not sure, although Bryan is apparently doing weird doll art now.

1.title: WTF? My Bloody Valentine's 'gift'
1.plot: A neighbor alerts Christine that someone who looked like a male left a card on her car. But then Christine notices an actual gift in her driveway. She calls her neighbor Dave over to help her examine it.

2.title: More CREEPY Stuff! And a Chance to Sleep!
2.plot: Christine's Aunt Sandy on the East Coast heard about her troubles and gave her a night in an upscale hotel so she could get a good night's sleep. But she found more creepy gifts in the bushes by the house.

3.title: Did the Stalker Find Me? I Can't Escape!
3.plot: Someone knocked on Christine's door at the hotel, but there was nobody there. She didn't tell anyone where she was going. Did the stalker follow her there?

4.title: Ex-boyfriend Has CREEPY Doll Art Exhibit
4.plot: Someone was lurking outside the coffee shop again. Chelsea brings a poster for a creepy doll art exhibit featuring work by Christine's ex-boyfriend Bryan. If he hasn't been leaving the scary packages, he sure is a good actor.

5.title: The Creeper Was in My Car!
5.plot: Christine's car was acting funny, so she pulled over to check it out. But she finds something in the back seat; the creeper must have gotten inside her car. She can't find her phone or purse, so she just runs.

6.title: Chilling! Someone's in My Garage
6.plot: Christine discovers the gift bag of horrors was stolen from the coffee shop break room and placed in her car. Worse, someone cut a belt in her car to make it stop running. Now there are noises coming from her patio or garage.

7.title: Dave's Wife Tells Horror Story
7.plot: Detective Johnson's wife says Christine can leave the bag of creepy "gifts" at their house. She also reveals that her husband is on administrative leave after a tough case that resulted in a young woman's death.

8.title: Dave's Gift Will Help Me Catch the Stalker
8.plot: Christine notices neighbor Dave Johnson lingering outside her house. Turns out he's got a hidden camera she might be able to use to catch the stalker.

9.title: Security Camera Installed!
9.plot: Dave helps Christine install the security camera. Now she hopes she can discover who has been making her life so hellish.

10.title: SHOCKING Security Camera Footage
10.plot: Christine is stunned by what turns up on the security camera. Her neighbor Dave appears to be poking around - and then a hooded figure pops out of the bushes.

11.title: Alone at Work. Is the Creeper Outside?
11.plot: Christine hates being on shift alone at work now, with exposed windows all around her. Mickey went out to get dinner, and it seems like someone was just rapping on the window.

12.title: Security Camera Stolen; I Can't Catch a Break!
12.plot: The security camera has been stolen. Footage clearly shows a gloved hand reaching up to the camera repeatedly, and now it's gone. Christine cannot catch a break from this nightmare.

1.title: Another Creepy Doll? I'm Tired of These Gifts
1.plot: When a friend drops Christine off at home after a dinner out, she finds another creepy box of horrors on her doorstep. Maybe even worse is that it smells like her shampoo.

2.title: More Evidence Against My Weird Ex-boyfriend
2.plot: The new girlfriend of Christine's ex-boyfriend seems to be videotaping the coffee shop. When Christine confronts her, Bryan shows up and they couple sniffs her hair. Her other friends are sure Bryan's the stalker; now to prove it.

3.title: Dave Is Missing! What Is Going on?
3.plot: Dave and his car have been missing all the time since the security camera disappeared, and the neighborhood has been unusually, strangely quiet. Is that just a coincidence?

4.title: SCARY Night Alone at Work
4.plot: Someone was banging on the coffee shop door and windows. Christine called the police and was told to file a suspicious activity report on the department's website. For a while, it was quiet - then it started again.

5.title: Ding Dong Ditch Returns. No Sleep for Me Tonight
5.plot: Once again, the doorbell is ringing repeatedly in the night. Looks like the creeper doesn't want Christine to get any sleep again. She doesn't even bother to go look.

6.title: Creepy Note on My Car
6.plot: Christine has closing shift at the coffee shop again. Carl shows up and startles her, but he came to walk her to her car. When they get to it, there's a note on the windshield..

7.title: Mickey's Brilliant Idea: Stalk the Stalker
7.plot: Bryan and Chelsea were hanging out at a food pod next to Christine's gym, and it's not in their part of town. Mickey suggests they film the couple, to see what they're up to.

8.title: Dave Sees Something CREEPY in My Yard!
8.plot: Dave is back and he's lingering on Christine's lawn. He reluctantly agrees to keep the box of gruesome doll gifts at his home, but he also lets Christine know there's something sinister in the bushes outside her home.

9.title: Scary Video Footage of Doll Massacre
9.plot: There's a new relic on Christine's doorstep: a doll with a thumb drive. She checks the drive and finds a video of gloved hands abusing one of her earlier doll gifts: cutting the hair, twisting off the limbs, and splashing "blood" on it.

10.title: Weirdest Poetry Night EVER!
10.plot: Bryan and Chelsea show up unexpectedly at the coffee house poetry night. Mickey and Christine decide to film it. Mickey, Chelsea, Bryan, and Carl all read something possibly revealing..

11.title: SCARY! Carl ATTACKED by Stalker!
11.plot: Someone's pounding on Christine's door. It's Carl, who's holding his bleeding nose: someone assaulted him right outside her house. Carl thinks it was Bryan, but he doesn't want her to call the police. Christine feels terrible about this.

12.title: Carl Stays the Night. Almost Catches Creeper!
12.plot: Carl stays over. Awakened by a loud noise at 3:08am, Christine can't find Carl when she calls. He finally appears and says someone's been in her driveway. They find her trash bins knocked over. "I didn't know it was this bad," he says.

1.title: Predator Becomes Prey
1.plot: Christine and Carl stake out Bryan's apartment. They witness Bryan and Chelsea carry a pile of bloody dolls out of the building. Could this be absolute proof that Bryan's the stalker?

2.title: Confronting My Ex-boyfriend!
2.plot: Christine, Carl, and Mickey decide to confront Bryan. Carl is too angry, though, so Christine tells Mickey to do the talking. Not only is Bryan's apartment full of creepy dolls, but he's dressed up as a doll with makeup, too.

3.title: Carl Gets a Creepy Gift!
3.plot: Carl finds a creepy doll on his car, too. He thinks it's a warning from the creeper because Carl is too close to Christine. "When's the last time you got something?" he asks. "Now I'm the one being stalked!"

4.title: Dave Sets Up a Trap to Catch Predator!
4.plot: Now Mickey has discovered a bloody doll on the front seat of her car. Neighbor Dave decides to set up a trip wire in Christine's driveway to catch the creeper. The trio waits for night to stake out the trap.

5.title: Someone Caught in Trap at Stakeout!
5.plot: While Christine, Dave, and Mickey were on stakeout in the night, someone got caught in the tripwire trap. But the person got away, leaving a bloody trail, and they can't call the police because the trip wire is illegal.

6.title: Someone Was in My House!
6.plot: During the stakeout, video picked up signs of an intruder inside Christine's house. Nothing looked unusual or missing inside, and the windows are all still locked, but then she hears knocking and freaks out.

7.title: Carl Says Some SCARY Things!
7.plot: Carl inspects the situation and upsets Christine even more by suggesting someone could be tracking her through her computer, and the person's injury by an illegal trip wire could be grounds for a lawsuit against her.

8.title: CREEPY Intruder at Work
8.plot: Mickey called in sick, so Christine is alone at the coffee shop near closing. Someone watches from across the street, then comes and pounds on the window. Christine caught it on tape, but couldn't tell who it was. Frantic, she calls Mickey.

9.title: Mickey to the Rescue!
9.plot: Though under the weather, Mickey comes to fetch a Christine from work. Badly shaken, Christine vows never to do a shift alone at the coffee shop again.

10.title: Jack Fires Me! Too Much Creepy Stuff at Work
10.plot: Jack, Christine's boss at the coffee shop, fires her, because of the creepiness and disruptions. She gets it, but the creeper is really messing up her life.

11.title: Carl Cheers Me Up
11.plot: Carl stops by to cheer up Christine after Jack has fired her. He says she made the best lattes, and Jack will go out of business without her. They decide to head to the park.

12.title: Creeper at the Park!
12.plot: Carl narrates a video report while at the park with Christine, but he notices somebody spying on them and runs over to investigate. Carl finds the same ball that was in her backyard. Christine just can't seem to catch a break.

13.title: Mystery Knock on the Door
13.plot: Back home, Christine reports she had to sell her big computer, managed to land a little freelance work, and is interviewing for other barista jobs. Then she hears more knocking.

14.title: Scariest Hike Ever! Creeper on the Trail!
14.plot: Hiking on a sunny day, Christine finds a bloody, severed doll head, hears snapping tree limbs and breaking glass, and finds a bottle of red liquid. Spooked, she runs - and her video cam is picked up by someone.

1.title: The Creeper Had My Camera!
1.plot: We see video shot by the stalker: the person rifles through Christine's car, then leaves in a blue hooded sweatshirt as streaks of fake blood run down the windshield. Christine appears and turns frantic: Does the stalker have all her keys?

2.title: Carl to the Rescue
2.plot: Carl cleans the car. The police came, took a report, and gave Christine the address of a detective who will study the stolen camera footage. Carl hints about moving in, but Christine doesn't respond. Good news, though: he finds her keys.

3.title: Foul Play with Mickey's Car?
3.plot: Mickey's car breaks down and Christine fears more foul play. Mickey's place is too small and cluttered for Christine to move in and escape the stalker. But nothing weird is happening to Mickey or at the coffee shop lately.

4.title: Creepy Intruder in My House!
4.plot: The safety lights in the backyard went off. After Christine gets them back on, a door creaks and glass breaks in the house. She hides under the bed, and an intruder goes through her bureau and closet, and steals her pink robe.

5.title: I Think I'm Going Crazy!
5.plot: Although the police promised to patrol the neighborhood, Mickey came over to calm Christine down. The police believe the intruder slipped in when she went out to turn on her patio lights. Carl is also coming over.

6.title: Mini-escape from My Nightmare Life
6.plot: Christine invited herself on a camping trip with friends to escape the nightmare at home. They listen to her story, discuss the merits of Carl and her ex, Bryan; but later that night she gets another scare at the campground.

7.title: Strange Neighbor Suddenly Concerned
7.plot: Christine's neighbor, Dia, is concerned about how much time Carl is spending around her place. Dia had heard about Christine's situation and is concerned. She doesn't trust men in general, and will be keeping a lookout.

8.title: We Caught a Creeper!
8.plot: Christine wakes up Carl in the middle of the night to check noises outside. Dia was prowling around with a headlamp and a golf putter. She is still suspicious of Carl, and an argument ensues on the street.

9.title: Mickey Said YES!
9.plot: Christine finally has some happy news: a very nervous Carl asked Mickey out, and she said YES. Mickey was surprised, because she always thought Carl was interested in Christine.

10.title: Jack Got a Box of CREEPY Dolls!
10.plot: Christine's former boss, Jack, got "dolled" as well, and he's terrified. He came to Christine because he didn't know what else to do. He said someone's been rapping on the windows of the coffee shop, too.

1.title: Strange Neighbors Acting Suspicious
1.plot: Christine's odd neighbor, Dia, is prowling around with her son Doogie. Christine invites them in, and Dia brings taffy and more golf clubs. The visitors notice the bad dolls Jack brought, and Doogie takes one, which upsets Dia.

2.title: Carl Left Me to Walk Home ALONE!
2.plot: Carl thinks he saw Bryan spying on them. He gets a phone call and runs off, abandoning Christine. An hour later, someone's ringing her doorbell again and leaving another creepy doll. Carl turns up only after the police respond.

3.title: Caught TRESPASSING!
3.plot: Dia shows up at Christine's in search of Doogie. She sent him over with taffy and her app says he's there, but Christine hasn't seen him. They find him in the hammock in her backyard, having buried the creepy doll.

4.title: Carl Shares Shocking News
4.plot: Carl is showing Christine his latest work site, with loud power tools, when she notices a sleeping bag. He admits his grandmother kicked him out several days ago. She says he can stay at her place, and he cries.

5.title: Mickey Meets My WEIRD Neighbors
5.plot: Christine and Mickey are putting up Halloween yard decorations when Dia and Doogie come by. Dia appears obsessed about Shelly, the "anxiety doll" they left at Christine's, and Doogie keeps poking in drawers and cupboards.

6.title: I Didn't Expect THIS from My Neighbor!
6.plot: Dia comes in the evening without Doogie to apologize for her earlier behavior, and has a bottle of pinot noir. She praises the Halloween decorations and shares some of her past. Christine decides she's nice although a little strange.

7.title: Creeper Strikes Again!
7.plot: As Dia and Christine settle to play cards, they hear tapping on the window. Dia heads out armed with a golf club, and they find another bloody doll on the porch. They call the police.

8.title: Surprise Visitors Share Unsettling News
8.plot: Dave has gone missing. Two police detectives show up to question Christine, because her neighbor's disappearance might be connected to the problems she has been experiencing. Now she's really upset.

9.title: Detectives grill me
9.plot: Cloud startles Christine while checking around her house, and Francis comes in an unlocked back door. Cloud rules out all the obvious suspects, and admits Dave has been missing long enough that the police believe he could be deceased.

10.title: What the Heck Did I Just Film?
10.plot: Christine is startled again by a doll in the window. Bryan has received a creepy doll too, but he's delighted, assumes Christine made and sent it, and wants her to collaborate on an art show with him.

11.title: Killer Clown Attack!!
11.plot: Christine is a kitty for Halloween, but Carl wants her to wear a bloody shirt as Stephen King's "Carrie." Dia shows up as a witch, armed with knives on patrol. She gets in an argument with Carl. Then a creepy clown rushes Christine's door.

12.title: I Called the Cops on the Clown
12.plot: The detectives show up, and Cloud apologizes for his treatment of Christine in the past. The clown shows up at her rear door and the cops chase him off. They also reveal the hairs and blood found in her driveway are a DNA match for Dave.

1.title: Bryan Is Obsessed!
1.plot: In Christine's car, she and Mickey discuss the five strange voice mails Bryan has left about his art show idea. Mickey recounts her disastrous first date with Carl, and Christine admits she's nervous about Detective Cloud.

2.title: Listen to Bryan's CREEPY Voicemails!
2.plot: Christine saves all five of Bryan's unsettling voice mail messages, in case she needs them for evidence. He talks of doing a doll show based on the story of "The Odyssey," ideas for publicity, and how to impress gallery owner Pierre.

3.title: Stood Up by Carl... Is He OK?
3.plot: Carl leaves Christine on the street. Jack is on his way to the theater, and Dia shows up looking for a video. Jack suggests Christine wait in the theater lobby for safety; Carl never shows. Another bloody doll turns up on her windshield.

4.title: Carl Has a Complete Meltdown!
4.plot: Carl texts Christine to meet him in a dicey area. He tells her he tried to sell some of his horror video collection to raise some rent money, had to stash it for 20 minutes, and then it disappeared. In shock, he goes nuts.

5.title: Carl's Video Collections STOLEN!
5.plot: Carl has calmed down but is devastated his video collection is lost. It was worth at least $500, he believes. Christine tries to cheer him up. The police won't help, he is certain, and he'll never talk to them.

6.title: The CREEPIEST Basement EVER
6.plot: Christine goes alone to Bryan's to tell him she can't be in his art show. In the basement of the building, Bryan talks to the doll he thought she had sent him, and then throttles it. Chelsea shows up, suspicious of Christine's presence.

7.title: Bryan Knows Who Made the CREEPY Doll!
7.plot: Bryan and Chelsea tell Christine it must be Bryan's rival from art school, Blaine Hammerschmidt (who used to date Chelsea), that made and sent the creepy puppet. Bryan thinks it's hilarious that Christine thought he had made it.

8.title: Doogie Shares DISTURBING Thoughts
8.plot: Doogie gives Christine a wreath containing knives. He plays her guitar, sings a frightening song, then asks if she's seen his mother. Doogie says his mom has been gone for a day. Then he says the creepy dolls are going to kill Christine.

9.title: Doogie LIED about his mom being missing!
9.plot: Upset, Christine has texted Dia all day. Finally her neighbor shows up and says she was holiday shopping. Dia is startled by the knives in her "missing" wreath, and by Carl's tree decorations. She leaves the wreath but takes the knives.

10.title: Doll Artist Seems Innocent!
10.plot: Christine, Bryan, and Chelsea confront the doll artist while pretending to shoot a documentary. He was a frequent coffee shop customer and a huge fan of Christine's mochas. She doesn't think he's the stalker.

11.title: Surprise Visit from Detective Francis
11.plot: Detective Francis drops by. The police have tried to reach Carl, but he hasn't answered their calls. Carl apparently has a sealed record but does not seem to be on probation. The officer also notices the door to Christine's garage is ajar.

12.title: Carl Is in BAD SHAPE!
12.plot: Christine finds Carl in her backyard shed. He went out for "a drink or two" last night, but has a bottle with him; he's embarrassed and apologetic. Carl dislikes the holidays; he reveals he lost his mother, a drug addict, when he was six.

13.title: Carl Promises to Call Detectives
13.plot: Next morning, Carl feels better and is still apologetic. Christine makes him promise to call the detectives back, as well as Mickey. He thinks the police should question Bryan.

1.title: Girl Talk; This Time It's About Boys, Not Dolls
1.plot: Christine has 3 job interviews, but Mickey urges her to take a mocha to Blaine. Christine is sure he's out of her league. Carl hasn't called Mickey, and Christine says he's been acting weird.

2.title: OMG! He's ALIVE!
2.plot: Sure she glimpsed him, Christine runs to Dave's house. The doorbell's broken, but the front door's ajar. Dave says he reported himself missing to get the police to start an investigation to help her. But that may have gotten him in trouble.

3.title: Dia Does Her Own Investigative Work
3.plot: Dia glimpsed Dave but he ran away from her. She thinks the detectives are not doing an adequate investigation of the stalking. She also wants to look into the disappearance of Carl's videos, and says Christine needs to kick him out.

4.title: I Brought Him a Mocha. I'm Still in SHOCK!
4.plot: Christine acts on Mickey's advice and takes Blaine a mocha. His door is ajar. She tells him she's still filming for Bryan's documentary. Blaine shows her his recent work, and she's nervous, giggly. He kisses her, and shuts the camera off.

5.title: Sharing the News with Mickey
5.plot: Christine relates to Mickey the news of her mocha delivery and surprise kiss. Blaine said he would text her about an actual date, too. Mickey's happy for her but wishes she had a similar effect on Carl.

6.title: Ride-along with Detective Cloud
6.plot: Detective Cloud shows up in undercover gear and beat-up car and tells Christine to get in. He says he's been shifted from Missing Persons to Narcotics, and he's decided to close her case.

7.title: Not This Again! A CREEPY Valentine's Gift!
7.plot: Dave shows up and tells Christine there's another unpleasant gift on her porch. He says she shouldn't open it, but just recycle it. It's a heart box, and looks like it contains chocolates, but they're not.

8.title: My SWEET Valentine!
8.plot: Blaine invites Christine to his place. It's a lovely evening, except someone rings the doorbell and no one's there (which he blames on the neighbor kids), and he gives her a valentine box that resembles the one from the other night.

10.title: Every Noise Is FREAKING Me Out!!
10.plot: Ever since the kids rang Blaine's doorbell, Christine's been obsessing over every unexplained noise. Tonight she hears things, keeps checking that the doors are locked. Will Blaine drop her if he learns about the stalker?

11.title: Carl Didn't Lie!!
11.plot: Dia is determined to investigate Carl's story about his lost videos. A store employee confirms his account, and says he might have gotten in a fight with another employee.

12.title: Creepy Intruder Delivers Box of HORRORS
12.plot: Christine hears more noises in her backyard. A hooded figure leaps up at the windows. Dia and Dave show up and investigate. Dia finds another "gift" at the back door, and Carl shows up at the last instant.

13.title: Opening BOX of HORRORS
13.plot: They open the box, and of course it's full of disgusting contents, including all kinds of eyeballs and a doll in a noose. The number 187 figures prominently. Christine calls Detective Francis.

1.title: Carl Is Going Crazy
1.plot: The snowstorm is driving the housebound Carl nuts. He messes with Christine's camera, tosses snowballs at the house, plays his guitar and sings, all of which bugs her while she's trying to work. She makes him a mocha to shut him up.

2.title: SO CREEPED OUT! Don't Know What to Do!
2.plot: It sounded as if Carl had left, but Christine still hears noises in the house. After searching all over, she gets jumped by Carl in a hoodie and brandishing an egg beater, which frightens her to death. How could he think that was funny?

3.title: Carl's heartfelt apology
3.plot: Carl makes an apology on camera: he made Christine's favorite dinner, traded his glasses for contact lenses, made an appointment for life coaching with Dia. At first, Christine hides in her room, but he finally coaxes a hug from her.

4.title: Another SUPER CREEPY Gift from the Stalker
4.plot: More strange noises come from the backyard, so Christine texts Dia. She comes over, finds a knocked-out board in the fence, and a doll hanging from a noose. The front door bell rings, and a large being leaps up.

5.title: The Police Are NO HELP!
5.plot: Carl's not home and doesn't answer texts. Jack shows up, saw the police car leaving and agrees to stay with Christine until Carl gets home. The doorbell rings again, but no one's there; they hear noises and pounding on the wall.

6.title: Jack Gets Attacked!!!
6.plot: Carl gets home very late, says he didn't answer his texts because his phone died. He spots Jack sleeping on the couch and, not recognizing who it is, and assaults him.

7.title: Life coaching session gets CRAZY!
7.plot: Dia sets up a life coaching session for Carl in Christine's backyard, but he seems less than enthusiastic. The discussion swiftly descends into shouting and accusations.

8.title: Somebody's in the garage!
8.plot: Jack comes over to offer his advice to Christine after the crazy life coaching session. He says she needs to take a break from Carl. Sh hears noises in the backyard and they go out to investigate.

9.title: Det. Francis agrees with Jack
9.plot: After hearing the shouting from the life coaching session, neighbors called the police, and Detective Francis showed up to look around. There's another doll in the garage. Francis agrees that Carl should move out.

10.title: Carl is MIA!
10.plot: Carl hasn't responded to Christine's many text messages. Mickey thinks she spots him at a food cart pod but can't locate him when she tries to talk to him. He's completely avoiding Christine now. Mickey says she can stay over sometimes.

11.title: Surprise visit provokes another creepy gift
11.plot: The doorbell rings at 10:30pm. It's Blaine. After he and Christine settle on the couch to visit, the doorbell rings again: it's another creepy doll gift. Christine tells Blaine about the stalker, and they decide to leave.

12.title: Scared silly by CRAZED guy with ax!
12.plot: After leaving Blaine's on a dark, rainy night, Christine finds her car door open. Then a man wielding an ax runs up and she races home in her car. But when she gets there, he shows up there too.

13.title: CREEPY attacker scared away
13.plot: Dia, on night patrol, scared off the attacker just in time. The two women run into Christine's home. Dia retrieves Christine's phone from the car so she can call Detective Francis. She suggests they set a trap for the stalker.

14.title: Carl spotted outside my house!
14.plot: Mickey spots Carl outside Christine's house, taking photos with his phone. Mickey searches his bags and finds articles of Christine's workout clothing and unlabeled DVDs. Christine decides to track down Carl's grandmother's house.

15.title: Video clerk gives me Carl's address!
15.plot: The video clerk gives Christine an address for Carl - probably his grandmother's home. She says she usually sees him at least once a week, but he hasn't showed up in at least a month. Christine decides to go straight to the address.

16.title: Carl's house is kinda creepy!
16.plot: Christine drives to Carl's grandma's house to try to find him. She rings at the front door, and knocks at the back door, but nobody answers. She decides to come back again later.

17.title: Creeping outside!
17.plot: Back at home, Christine can't get to sleep and it's after midnight. Noises outside her house are freaking her out. She decides to call Dia.

18.title: Weird ritual in my backyard
18.plot: Shrouded in a red shawl, Doogie lays an odd array of objects on a table in Christine's backyard. He claims to have played chess with Carl there, and sent photos to him. Then something happens, and Christine hustles everyone into the house.

19.title: More help setting up the trap
19.plot: Christine is about to clean up Doogie's mess of artifacts when Jack shows up to check on her. Then Dave appears and shows her a hole in the fence where the intruder gets in. He agrees to help her set a trap for the stalker.

1.title: Stalker Attack Plan!
1.plot: The backyard gate and garage door are open; chairs are spread across the lawn. It turns out Dia is building a trap for the stalker. She says she deleted Carl's number from Doogie's phone. After she's gone, Christine gets another scare.

2.title: Surprised by unexpected picnic guest!
2.plot: Christine is having a relaxing picnic in the park with Blaine when Carl suddenly shows up. Blaine steps away while Carl and Christine have a heated chat. Then Carl wanders off awkwardly and Blaine and Christine discuss what happened.

3.title: A fun and fearless night.. or is it?
3.plot: It's nearly midnight; Christine can't sleep. She goes through the bags Carl left behind. Apart from the unlabeled disks, she finds a Barbie mermaid doll. Blaine gets up and persuades her to return to bed. Then they hear a scream outside.

4.title: Blaine to the rescue
4.plot: Someone in a gray hoodie with a headlamp is prostrate in Christine's backyard. Dia, injured and humiliated, fell into her own trap. She comes in to get cleaned up, and is VERY impressed by bare-chested Blaine.

5.title: Snooping through Carl's bag
5.plot: Mickey teases Christine about Blaine. They decide to go through Carl's bags. Mickey thinks all the unlabeled DVDs are blanks; Christine tests one on her computer and can't find anything. Then they hear a noise in the backyard.

6.title: The strangest detour EVER!
6.plot: On their way to a barbecue, Jack and Christine stop by Carl's grandmother's house. A creepy woman startles them, becomes obsessed with resetting a birdhouse on a fence. Then a loud noise comes from the neighboring structure.

7.title: Why is he so BLOODY?!
7.plot: Jack and Christine return to the house the next day. When Carl's Grandma appears in the window, they hear Carl yell from the other building. He appears in a bloody shirt carrying a knife, and Grandma drags him into the house.

8.title: Another Strange Twist to This Craziest Day!
8.plot: Trying to learn what "films" Grandma meant, Jack searched the unlabeled DVDs and found nothing. He and Christine see a dark figure on the street. Detective Cloud shows up, as well as another gruesome doll with a message.

9.title: Halloween prankster or the creeper?
9.plot: In costume, Christine and Blaine are headed to a party. Dia shows up fully masked, and waving a burning sage bundle. Another cloaked and masked figure turns up, and Christine gives chase.

10.title: Det. Francis questions Carl's Grandma. FINALLY!
10.plot: Detective Francis and Christine visit Carl's Grandma at night to inquire after Carl and the bloody shirt. She offers a semi-plausible explanation while also dropping innuendos about Christine. The visitors depart in some haste.

11.title: Dave's new plan to catch creeper
11.plot: Christine sees Dave standing on the sidewalk with a rubber decapitated head on a rope. He wants to set a trap for the stalker near the place in her back fence where the intruder broke in earlier.

12.title: They're fighting! This is CRAZY!
12.plot: Christine meets Blaine on a freeway overpass. He wants her to shut off the video camera to discuss something. Carl comes running up, thinking Blaine is hassling her, and the two get into a shoving match.

13.title: Creepiest text EVER!
13.plot: Christine ignores Blaine's text messages, but then a mysterious one announces she left her back door unlocked. She hears other sounds around the house, then the doorbell rings. It's Jack, who shows her a photo someone left on her door.

14.title: The waiting game
14.plot: While they wait for Detective Francis to arrive, Jack observes that it was weird that Carl happened to be around when Blaine and Christine were walking to her house, just before the men fought. Her front bell rings, but nobody is there.

15.title: BLOODY gift left under bush
15.plot: Dia drops by and notices something next to Christine's porch: a butcher's cleaver that looks like it has blood on it. Dia brings it in, sees the photo of Doogie also left at the door, and resolves to talk to Dave about another stakeout.

16.title: Detective Francis collects evidence
16.plot: Det. Francis collects evidence for the forensics lab: the cleaver, the photo of Doogie, and a glove under the bush. Christine says she's worried about Carl; he advises her to stay with Blaine but be "smart and safe about it."

17.title: Caught in the trap!
17.plot: On a cold night, Dia and Dave set up a stakeout for the stalker with a net and rope while Christine waits inside the house as bait. A jacketed figure shows up in the backyard and they catch him.

1.title: Blaine apologizes for losing his cool
1.plot: Christine has decided to stop filming herself with Blaine but forgets to turn the camera off when he arrives. Back from France, he apologizes for losing his temper and brings gifts. They talk about their concerns regarding Carl.

2.title: Dave GRILLS man in Christine's driveway
2.plot: Dave spots a man rifling through Christine's recycling bin. Dave and Christine confront him, and Christine thinks the stranger seems to be a harmless homeless guy, but Dave is more suspicious.

3.title: CREEPY gift for Dia
3.plot: Christine thinks someone's been caught in Dave's trap. Dia comes over, and they find two dolls in it: one sawing the other's neck with a hacksaw. Then they find an even more frightening message for Dia on Christine's back door.

4.title: Another CREEPY gift
4.plot: Detective Francis reports that the lab found rat's blood on the cleaver. A new relic is on the doorstep: a small coffin. After he opens it, Francis explains to Christine and Blaine what he thinks is going on, and how they should proceed.

5.title: Searching for clues
5.plot: Christine and Mickey scour the creepy gifts - not just the dolls and photos, but the cups from the coffee shop, early photos of Christine at the gym - for clues. Christine thinks it's Carl but becomes more ever more confused.

6.title: Dave stands guard on Valentine's Eve
6.plot: Hoping to catch the stalker, Dave watches Christine's house on Valentine's Eve night. She speaks with him and he admits the reason he's on administrative leave. Sick with worry, Christine is still up after midnight.

7.title: Mickey hatches a new plan!
7.plot: Distraught, Christine stays at Mickey's for support. Mickey examines the Valentine's gift that was left on her friend's porch, and says she doesn't believe the stalker is Carl. But she recommends they stalk him to make sure.

8.title: Some really CREEPY shoppers
8.plot: Christine and Mickey overhear Carl's grandma say something ominous about Carl to another man who looks vaguely familiar. When Carl shows up, Mickey feels they should warn him, so the girls follow the creepy family's car to their home.

9.title: The creepiest barn EVER!
9.plot: From outside, Christine and Mickey see Carl's grandma prepare something in the kitchen, then call for Carl to get his pudding. Worried about him, they race around the house to the barn, where they see and hear unsettling things.

10.title: Who is this creepy guy?
10.plot: Christine and Mickey make up a story to get away from the weird guy in the barn. Mickey stops Carl from eating what she thinks is poisoned pudding before his grandma runs her off the property.

11.title: An update after that CRAZY night
11.plot: After the strange encounter at Carl's grandmother's home and in the barn, Christine can't sleep, so she turns over what has happened, but comes up with more questions than answers. Mickey has texted her that Carl's all right, though.

12.title: Hatching a new plan
12.plot: Christine tries to fill Dia in on the latest over the phone, but the line cuts off, so Dia comes over. Dia suggests that she stake out Carl's grandma's place, with Christine on lookout with a video camera.

13.title: Stalking Carl and his CREEPY family
13.plot: Christine films Carl's family selling pork jerky in her neighborhood, and Carl outside the coffee shop where she used to work. Amanda suggests she could pose as a TV news reporter and interview the family about their street business.

14.title: Investigating BIZARRE 'pork' jerky roadside stand
14.plot: Posing as a TV news reporter and camera person, Amanda and Christine confront Carl, his Grandma, and Ezekiel in the street. Carl quickly becomes suspicious and the family packs up and leaves in a hurry.

1.title: Going undercover for CREEPY barn stakeout
1.plot: Christine and Dia decide to do an undercover stakeout, in heavy disguises, of Carl's grandma's creepy barn. Dia comes armed with power water guns filled with pepper water. At 1:30am, they make their move. . . .

2.title: Prowling around the SCARY barn
2.plot: Prowling around the barn, Christine and Dia see a light on, see a pile of sawdust on the driveway and speculate on its meaning, think they hear sawing inside the barn, then Dia spots a man with a cleaver, and they run.

3.title: Is the CREEPER outside?
3.plot: Back home, Christine tries to process what happened at the barn, and hears - and maybe sees - someone in her backyard at 3am. She expects Dia and listens anxiously for the "special knock" they agreed on, but doesn't hear it. . . .

4.title: Is this a death threat?
4.plot: Christine hears noises and finds Dave and Det. Francis outside. They find an elaborate shrine with candles, crosses, bloody dolls, and the names of all her friends, even Mickey and Amanda. She calls them to make sure everyone's all right.

5.title: Did he just dump me?
5.plot: Blaine takes a midnight flight home from his art show to respond to Christine's crisis, but he suggests she's obsessing about the situation when nothing serious has really happened. He also "needs a break" and suggests some time apart.

6.title: Dia to the rescue - AGAIN!
6.plot: Dia comes over to console Christine after her breakup with Blaine. They discuss new approaches to catch the stalker: Christine has found an app that will turn old phones into security cameras to post at the front and back of the house.

7.title: Stalker leaves another CREEPY gift
7.plot: A loud noise awakens Christine and Dia. The makeshift window shade fell down, but there's a light and a face outside the window. It's the stalker. Dia grabs a bat and races out, but finds nothing but another disturbing doll gift.

8.title: Creepy footage on flash drive
8.plot: A flash drive turns up inside the doll. Dia insists on viewing the contents. They find video clips of Christine in her home, with guests, at the Dollar Tree store, in and outside the coffee shop - most of it many months old.

9.title: Feeling hopeless but moving forward
9.plot: Devasted by the videos on the flash drive, Christine shares her feelings and clips from her homemade security camera. It hasn't turned up anything. Blaine has been texting to request a talk, Mickey says she's seen Carl at the coffee shop.

10.title: AWKWARD encounter with Carl
10.plot: Christine and Jack spot Carl at the neighborhood food cart pod. Everyone is uncomfortable, Carl says the police have been questioning him and his grandma, and he and Christine wind up shouting at each other.

11.title: Carl's notebook is suspect!
11.plot: Christine and Jack tell Dia of the awkward encounter with Carl. Jack thinks he recognizes Carl's notebook from the coffee shop months before. The three plot how to steal it. Another creepy gift appears on the doorstep.

12.title: My security camera is gone!
12.plot: Christine can't identify who left the creepy gift because the hidden cell phone security camera is gone. She obsesses about Carl's notebook, and wonders if Det. Cloud may have contacted Carl. Why is Dia suspicious of Jack?

13.title: Operation Notebook!
13.plot: Mickey alerts Christine that Carl is at the coffee shop, so she and Dia try to track him and get the notebook. They have a near miss outside a grocery store, then lose him.

14.title: Dia snagged the notebook!
14.plot: Christine and Dia spot Carl's car parked outside the coffee shop. Dia goes in disguised as "Alice" and steals his notebook, but Carl gives chase and gets the notebook back before they can see the contents.

15.title: I'm having a meltdown!
15.plot: Christine tries to make sense of what happened with Carl when she and Dia tried to steal his notebook. He texted her with a photo of her and Dia in her car that day and the comment "Who's stalking who?" She has a meltdown on camera.

16.title: Psychic feels a dark energy
16.plot: Dia contacts her psychic friend Becky to see if she can help Christine. As "Angel," she senses a dark male energy stalking Christine, and also picks up coffee, Mickey Mouse, pigtails, and other emanations.

17.title: Why is Dave so mad?
17.plot: Amanda tells Christine she found Carl on a dating site and she's thinking of going out with him to investigate. Christine likes this but warns her to be careful. Dave pops up and angrily asks Christine why she hasn't kept him informed.

18.title: Another CREEPY encounter
18.plot: Christine and Mickey try to decipher the psychic's readings when Carl suddenly shows up. Mickey tries to be nice to him, Christine is more suspicious, but when they express interest in the purple notebook, Carl runs away.

1.title: Neighbor Dave vows to solve my case
1.plot: Tire of the unsolved stalking, Dave shows up at Christine's and demands to go through all the evidence to crack the case. They work through her notebooks and other evidence until 2:30 a.m. Christine has told Amanda not to go out with Carl.

2.title: Dia's at it again!
2.plot: On day 2 of Dave's in-depth investigation, Dia rings the doorbell and demands to why she wasn't included. She's upset about problems with Doogie, but decides to investigate MeeMaw's on her own. Christine does not think this is a good idea.

3.title: A VERY awkward encounter
3.plot: Christine goes to the park to meet Mickey, but Carl shows up and behaves very strangely. He flashes a page or two of the purple notebook, but won't show her the rest of it. She leaves in haste.

4.title: Christine's not the only one being stalked!
4.plot: Blaine turns up at Christine's and apologizes because he's now being stalked. He keeps seeing the same guy watching his house and following him around, and someone broke into his office and stole a box of dolls. Then the doorbell rings.

5.title: Blaine makes an interesting offer
5.plot: While Jack ices his injured knee, Blaine suggests Christine stay in a wing of his new residence for safety. Though still hurt and angry about how he dumped her, she says she'll think about it. Mickey and Jack think it's a good idea.

6.title: Creepy discovery while prowling around
6.plot: Dia texts Christine that she's investigating MeeMaw's property, and Christine rushes over. Posing as a sales person, Dia is prowling the yard, and has found some extremely suspicious items. The two women argue over what to do next.

7.title: Was that a FREAKING dead body?
7.plot: The women realize they caught someone dragging a body on the video. Det. Francis says the people told him they are setting up a Halloween "Funhouse." Still suspicious, Christine gets Dave to agree to join her in looking further into it.

8.title: Halloween house of horrors!
8.plot: Christine, Mickey, and Dave go in costume to MeeMaw's haunted house. It's elaborately decorated, with creepy sound effects, masked figures leaping out and yelling, and wrapped "bodies" lying all over. But is it suspicious?

9.title: Creepy Halloween night continues
9.plot: While Dave returns to MeeMaw's to investigate further, Christine waits at home. She get a strange text from Dia, then a pounding on the door, a bloody hand on the window, and yet another gift doll with gravestone and butcher knife.

10.title: Dave collected evidence
10.plot: Dave returns from MeeMaw's with items collected for analysis at the lab: bloody leaf, bits of bloody fabric that were hanging from the fence and trees, a piece of shoe from the mound in the yard. Christine shows him her latest "dollivery."

11.title: Another "dollivery" and Dia's still ghosting me!
11.plot: Christine discovers her stalker left further "gifts" in her yard. Neighbor girl Chloe happens by, and Christine verifies with her that Dia was apparently receiving trick-or-treaters on Halloween night (although she was in a mask).

12.title: Dia's still ghosting me!
12.plot: Christine has received no responses to her texts and phone messages for Dia, no answer when she's gone to her door, and the car Dia borrowed from her sister is gone. Christine speculates on what could have happened.

13.title: Psychic is freaked out!
13.plot: Christine is plagued by repeated knocking on her windows one night. A distraught Angel phones and describes via Skype her disturbing visions of a frantic Carl running, Dia tied up, and Doogie sunk in deep regret for something "really bad."

imdb.title: Stalked
plot: Christine, a single woman who lives alone, discovers she is being stalked and decides to document the experience - in case she goes missing.
